Sequence Information.Peptide Name: LS-AMP-E1 (Lys-rich; natural AMPs; Spiders, arachnids, Chelicerata, arthropods, invertebrates, animals, UCLL1)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (45.83%) toUperin 2.7K: 28%, I=G: 17%, L=A: 11%. GRAVY: -0.061; Mol Wt: 1898.371; mol formula: C85H157N23O22S1; mol ex coeff: 0.Activity:  active against Gram- S. typhimurium CGMCC1.1174 (MIC 12.5 uM), E. coli  CCTCC AB 2012883 and 10 clinical strains (MIC 6.25-50 uM), P. aeruginosa 4 clinical strains (MIC 50->50), A. baumannii 6 clinical strains (MIC 25-100 uM), S. dysenteriae CGMCC 1.1869 (MIC 50 uM), P-vulgaris CGMCC 1.1651 (MIC >50 uM), Gram+ E. faecium 2 clinical strains (MIC 50-100 uM), S. albus CGMCC 1.3374 (MIC 12.5 uM), S.aureus  4 clincial strains (MIC>100 uM), and S. citreus CCTCC AB 91115 (MIC 6.25 uM). Inhibit the formation of biofilms:bacteria:E. coli.Synergy:antibiotics:   Synergy with Doxycycline against E. coli and synergy with Azithromycin or Erythromycin against S. albus.
Literature Information.Author: Tan H, Wang J, Song Y, Liu S, Lu Z, Luo H, Tang X.2022
Literature Information.Title: Antibacterial Potential Analysis of Novel alpha-Helix Peptides in the Chinese Wolf Spider Lycosa sinensis.
